summary: This bill, the "Wild Olympics Wilderness and Wild and Scenic Rivers Act," proposes to designate and expand wilderness areas within the Olympic National Forest in Washington State. It also designates specific river segments within Olympic National Forest and Olympic National Park as "wild and scenic rivers," with varying classifications (wild, scenic, recreational) and management responsibilities. The bill outlines the administration of these areas, including provisions for fire control and potential wilderness designation, while preserving existing rights and withdrawing the land from certain activities. It aims to protect the natural environment and resources of the Olympic Peninsula.
